authors.author: Daniel B. Towner William R. Newell (1895)

verse.name: c1a
verse.lines:
Mercy there was great
and grace was free;

Pardon there
was multiplied to me;

verse.name: c1b
verse.lines: There my burdened soul found liberty,
At Calvary.

verse.name: v1a
verse.lines:
Years I spent in vanity
and pride,

Caring not my Lord
was crucified,

verse.name: v1b
verse.lines:
Knowing not
it was for me He died
On Calvary.

verse.name: v2a
verse.lines:
By God's Word at last
my sin I learned;
Then I trembled at the law I'd spurned,

verse.name: v2b
verse.lines: Till my guilty soul imploring turned
To Calvary.

verse.name: v3a
verse.lines: Now I've giv'n to Jesus ev'rything;

Now I gladly own Him
as my King;

verse.name: v3b
verse.lines:
Now my raptured soul
can only sing
Of Calvary.

verse.name: v4a
verse.lines:
O the love
that drew salvation's plan!

O the grace
that brought it down
to man!

verse.name: v4b
verse.lines:
O the mighty gulf
that God did span
At Calvary!
